column1: A qualitative HCG blood test checks if there is a hormone called human chorionic gonadotropin in your blood.
HCG is a hormone produced in the body during pregnancy.
Other HCG tests include: - HCG urine test - Quantitative pregnancy test (checks specific level of HCG in your blood)
HCG level in the blood may also be high in women with certain types of ovarian tumors or in men with testicular tumors.

If your blood HCG is positive and you do not have a pregnancy properly implanted in the uterus, it may indicate: - Ectopic pregnancy - Miscarriage - Testicular cancer (in men) - Trophoblastic tumor - Hydatidiform mole - Ovarian cancer
